alert.note: Alert for Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 26 at 8:31PM CDT until June 26 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MDT FOR NORTHWESTERN KIMBALL AND EASTERN LARAMIE COUNTIES... At 731 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 9 miles southeast of Albin, or 17 miles west of Kimball, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Kimball and eastern Laramie Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. This is a dangerous storm, producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck.
